title: Óengus I
summary: Óengus son of Fergus (Pictish: *Onuist map Vurguist;[lower-alpha 1] Old Irish: Óengus mac Fergusso, "Angus son of Fergus"), was king of the Picts from 732 until his death in 761. His reign can be reconstructed in some detail from a variety of sources. The unprecedented gains he made, and the legacy he left, mean Óengus can be considered the first king of what would become Scotland.
